meanings.definition: Refrain from insisting on or demanding something; relinquish a right or claim.
meanings.sent1: She decided to waive her request for a refund.
meanings.sent2: The company agreed to waive the late fee for the customer.
meanings.sent3: After much thought, he chose to waive his opportunity to speak first.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, sometimes you have to waive your pawn to protect your queen.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to waive their usual homework assignment for the week.

meanings.definition: Postpone or refrain from enforcing a rule or requirement.
meanings.sent1: The school decided to waive the dress code for the special event.
meanings.sent2: The referee chose to waive the penalty due to the weather conditions.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to waive the rule of not jumping on the table when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The artist decided to waive the usual color scheme for a more experimental approach.
meanings.sent5: The manager had to waive the usual procedure to accommodate the urgent request.

meanings.definition: Give up a right or claim voluntarily.
meanings.sent1: He had to waive his inheritance to avoid conflicts within the family.
meanings.sent2: The athlete decided to waive his spot on the team to give others a chance.
meanings.sent3: The magician jokingly offered to waive his ability to perform tricks for a day.
meanings.sent4: She had to waive her ownership of the project to allow for collaboration.
meanings.sent5: The explorer had to waive his discovery to protect the endangered species.
